Personal Profile
Highly motivated, proactive with a strong work ethic. Thrive in a collaborative team environment but also comfortable when working on my own initiative. Able to demonstrate exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, attention to detail, methodical and used to working to stringent client led deadlines.
Keen to secure a new opportunity, where I am able to utilise my academic knowledge gained and also enhance recently acquired commercial skills.
Voluntary Roles
STEM ambassador since 2016, partaking in activities in Nottingham and Manchester.
Education
Sept 2014 – July 2018          University of Nottingham

Personal Profile
Highly motivated, proactive with a strong work ethic. Thrive in a collaborative team environment but also comfortable when working on my own initiative. Able to demonstrate exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, attention to detail, methodical and used to working to stringent client led deadlines.
Keen to secure a new opportunity, where I am able to utilise my academic knowledge gained and also enhance recently acquired commercial skills.
Voluntary Roles
STEM ambassador since 2016, partaking in activities in Nottingham and Manchester.
Education
Sept 2014 – July 2018          University of Nottingham
MEng (Hons) in Chemical Engineering
Classification: 1st - degree included four design projects.
Sept 2007 – July 2013	Loreto Grammar School, Altrincham
A-Levels: Chemistry (A), Maths (A), Physics (B)
GCSE: 11 Grades 5 A*, 1 A, 5 B
Core Skills
MATLAB-Simulink, MATLAB - mathematical based algorithm development
Aspen HYSYS & Sim Create chemical process simulator
IBM SPSS statistical software.
AutoCAD and RasterCAD At MRA Projects Oct 18 -Present
IT proficient in Microsoft Office
Problem Solving
Team working
Data analysis
Communication
Possess a clean and full UK driving license and a car.
Technical & Employment history
October 2018- Present	Trainee Interface Engineer
MRA projects
Undertaking tasks on substation control system (SCS) replacement projects under guidance of lead interface engineer.
Taking a lead role in SCS replacement projects and working to client specified deadlines.
Able to review design intended scope of work and understanding the scheme philosophy to implement all the required modifications to associated wiring, arrangement and cable details  using AutoCAD and RasterCAD.
Attend regular client facing progress meetings on-site with stakeholders.
Technical Skills
2014 –2018 			University of Nottingham
Fundamentals of engineering design - designed water treatment plants in 1st year projects.
Plant design - designed LNG stabilisation unit in 2nd year project.
Design project - designed Sulphuric acid regeneration plant in 3rd year project.
MEng project - designed copper extraction process in 4th year project.
Documents in Projects:-  included Environmental, Process Safety Assessment, Functional Design specification, Design Proposal and Equipment Specification.
Designed heat exchangers, absorption unit and pipelines in projects along with production of mass and energy balances.
Evaluating process safety using HAZID and HAZOP analysis.
Prepared P&ID drawings for 3 projects.
Modelled fluid flow through a pipe using MATLAB.
Successfully simulated a process producing toluene from n-heptane using Aspen HYSYS.
Planning and completing laboratory work to test the limitations of 4th year design project.
2011 – 2012, 2016- 2018  	Care Assistant
The Knoll Care Partnership
(Part Time whilst studying)
Valued member of a team of 3-4 people, providing care for 20 residents of varying physical and mental health.
Communicating effectively with the staff, residents and their families.
Duties included providing personal care, meals, laundry, a safe caring environment for the residents and writing hourly care reports.
Volunteering,  Roles of Responsibility & Presentations
Sept 2012 - July 2013 	Head Girl
Head girl during sixth form, voted in by students and staff.
Chairing a committee of 12 students.
Speaking in Bridgewater hall Loreto Grammar Speech night to second guest speaker
Acting as a conduit between students and teachers.
Organised prom and a Christmas party in collaboration with St Ambrose Grammar School.
Leading the school in raising £13,000 whilst holding the position of head girl.
Sept 2013 – July 2014 	 Step into the Gap
Catholic Agency for Overseas Development
(Full Time)
Working in a team to plan bespoke workshops for young people aged 5-18 years old in schools across the UK. Workshops included themes of team building, making better leaders, self-awareness, caring for the planet, global issues.
Leading workshops to groups of 30-60 young people.

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
